intro: Sporobolus arizonicus, commonly known as Arizona threeawn, is a perennial grass native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces spikelets that are typically three to five in number, giving it its common name. Its inflorescence is a dense, cylindrical cluster of small, bristly flowers. Arizona threeawn is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
